Title: Mother's Vascular Skin Lesions Increase Risk for Offspring
Teaser: Findings of a large population-based study supported a possible heritable component for angioma and especially for port-wine stain.

Title: GPs Encouraged to Test, Treat Latent TB in Immigrants
Teaser: Primary care in the United Kingdom is poised to take over TB management.

Title: Key Learning Points: BASHH Anogenital Warts
Teaser: Dr Amy Cleese reviews the diagnosis and management of anogenital warts in general practice, offering six key learning points from updated guidance

Title: Alternate Insomnia Therapy Has Good Showing
Teaser: The brief nurse-delivered therapy aimed at restricting and standardising time in bed could make treatment more accessible to primary care patients.

Title: Recurrent UTI: Undercultured, Overtreated Despite Resistance
Teaser: Roughly 40% of general practitioners do not culture recurrent UTIs and instead, just treat.

Title: High-Dose Psilocybin Shows Promising Results for Depression
Teaser: A meta-analysis found that high-dose psilocybin for depressive symptoms showed better responses than placebo or escitalopram in antidepressant trials.

Title: UK's Hereditary Cardiac Amyloidosis Rates Higher Than Expected
Teaser: The researchers urged increased clinical vigilance for hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis in patients with symptoms or unexplained heart muscle thickening.

Title: How Can Primary Care Teams Collaborate More Effectively?
Teaser: View from the ground, by Dr Honor Merriman

Title: Does Gram Stain Enhance UTI Diagnosis in the ED?
Teaser: Compared with other methods, urine Gram stain moderately predicted gram-negative bacteria but added little value to UTI diagnosis in the ED, raising questions about its clinical utility.
